items.headline: How to tariff-proof your holiday shopping list
items.summary_en: This year, the strategy for savvy holiday shoppers is not just finding a discount, but entirely avoiding the tariff burden by focusing on U.S.-made gifts, imported products with low tariff rates, gift cards and experiences.

items.headline: Where Goldman Sachs says the S&P 500 is headed next year and the next decade
items.summary_en: Goldman strategists expect the S&P 500 will see annualized gains of 6.5% in the next 10 years. But that’s not exactly shooting for the moon.

items.headline: Banks just sent this upbeat signal about the economy. Here’s why investors aren’t buying it.
items.summary_en: Banks stockpiled less money for troubled loans during the most recent quarter despite fears over bad-debt “cockroaches.”

items.headline: What typically comes next when the stock market sputters at the start of November
items.summary_en: The S&P 500 slumped 1.6% last week — but bad first weeks in November usually don’t hang over the stock market.

items.headline: It might not be Peak Oil after all. What the IEA’s new scenarios mean for oil prices.
items.summary_en: The key international agency forecasting energy demand now says the current path will have consumption of oil and gas growing through 2050, as electric-vehicle adoption misses its earlier estimates.
